title: The Medieval Islamic Civilization - Col. 17 (History, Legacy 5)
description:
The Medieval Islamic Civilization - Collection 17 (History, Legacy 5):

We have 17 titles here:

-  Aigle - The Mongol Empire between Myth and Reality; Studies in Anthropological History (2015)

-  Al-Khalili - The House of Wisdom; How Arabic Science Saved Ancient Knowledge and Gave Us the Renaissance (2010)

-  Allman - The Rise of Islam (2015)

-  Azumah - The Legacy of Arab-Islam in Africa; a Quest for Inter-Religious Dialogue (2001)

-  Borrut & Cobb (Eds.) - Umayyad Legacies; Medieval Memories from Syria to Spain (2010)

-  Doubleday - The Wise King; a Christian Prince, Muslim Spain, and the Birth of the Renaissance (2015)

-  Heilo - Eastern Rome and the Rise of Islam; History and Prophecy (2016)

-  Hertel - The Crescent Remembered; Islam and Nationalism on the Iberian Peninsula (2015)

-  Imamuddin - Muslim Spain, 711-1492 A.D.; a Sociological Study (1981)

-  Kemper - A Labyrinth of Kingdoms; 10,000 Miles through Islamic Africa (2012)

-  Lapidus - Islamic Societies to the Nineteenth Century; a Global History (2012)

-  Nicolle - Saracen Strongholds, AD 630-1050; the Middle East and Central Asia (2008)

-  Ricci - Islam Translated; Literature, Conversion, and the Arabic Cosmopolis of South and Southeast Asia (2011)

-  Sluglett & Currie - Atlas of Islamic History (2014)

-  The New Cambridge History of Islam; Vol. 5, the Islamic World in the Age of Western Dominance, Ed. F. Robinson (2010)

-  The New Cambridge History of Islam; Vol. 6, Muslims and Modernity Culture and Society since 1800, Ed. R.W. Hefner (2010)

-  von Grunebaum - Medieval Islam; a Study in Cultural Orientation, 2e (1953)
